channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Carriage way cover, 3rd August
item.description:
There is a manhole in the main road outside windrush house and the local shops, the cover is extremely loose, as cars drive over it the cover dips causing the "banging, clanging" noise- not only is unsafe for drivers but also a noise nuisance as the local residents can hear the banging, clanking noise through the evening and early mornings as cars, lorries drive over it. please repair ASAP
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken pipework in council owned grass verge next to public footpath, 3rd August
item.description:
There is a broken pipe and other metalwork pushing through the grass on the council owned grass verge between the public footpath and 14 Alverton Drive.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: 2 drains blocked, standing water creating potholes and pedestrians get splashed, 3rd August
item.description:

item.title: Disgusting public toilets, 2nd August
item.description:
Pitville Park toilets are run down, graphiti d and stink. They need new toilets, urinals and tiling They are used by thousands of visitors to our town and residents, daily They are a very poor reflection on our town
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84, All Saints' Road, Fairview, Cheltenham

item.title: Question on dispute that Barley Road has not been adopted byGCC Highways, 2nd August
item.description:
Why are Stagecoach Office Employees saying that Barley Road can’t be used by them as it hasn’t been adopted yet by GCC Highways - Contractor still owns it !! Why have 100’s of PCN’s been issued to vehicles if it’s a Private Road still ?? Perhaps Stagecoach just don’t want to use it and like causing congestion and dangerous situations with their buses coming through Tatchley Lane?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection (2nd August 2025), 2nd August
item.description:
Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection. Two bags, one containing general litter and the other cans/plastic bottles for recycling. Near to the Innsworth Lane Sports Ground sign. The 'What 3 Words' location is ///examiner.slopes.courage The ordnance survey map reference is: 51.883919,-2.213313 Council Litter Bin Ref: 0254

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Litter picking bags ready for collection

item.title: Deep Cracks in the field, 2nd August
item.description:
There are a number of deep cracks within the field that need to be addressed. The cracks have been growing bigger for about a month. Its not one or two, its several deep cracks. This can cause someone or animal serious harm. I am worried that a paw might get caught if a dog is running or a child's foot.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aston Grove, Golden Valley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes in the road, 2nd August
item.description:
To be frank, the entire road is full of potholes from the top of Harp Hill all the way to the bottom. There isn't one specific pothole as such but rather a multitude that create signficant problems on the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
